name: Dulcamara
Relationship: Incompatible: BELLAD.; LACHES.Antidotes: CAMPH.; CUPR.Compare: PIMPINELLA - (Bibernell). Respiratory mucous membrane sensitive to drafts, pain and coldness in occiput and nape. Whole body weak; heavy head and drowsiness; lumbago and stiff neck; pain from nape to shoulder; chilliness. RHUS; CIMICIF.; CALC.; PULS.; BRY.; NAT-SULPH.Complementary: BARYTA CARB.
Modalities: Worse: at night; from cold in general

Stool: Green, watery, slimy, bloody, mucus, especially in summer, when the weather suddenly becomes cold; from damp, cold weather and repelled eruptions
Head: Buzzing in head
Ringworm of scalp
Back part of head chill, heavy, aching, during cold weather
Rejects things asked for
Mental confusion
Headache relieved by conversation
Thick brown crusts, scalded head, bleeding when scratched
Occipital pain ascending from nape of neck
Fever: Chilliness towards evening, mostly in back
Dry hat and burning of skin
Stomach: Nausea accompanies the desire for stool
Mouth: Facial neuralgia; worse, slightest exposure to cold
Dry, rough tongue, rough scraping in throat, after taking cold in damp weather
Respiratory: Must cough a long time to expel phlegm
Cough worse cold, wet weather, with free expectoration, tickling in larynx
Whooping-cough, with excessive secretion of mucus
Loose, rattling cough; worse wet weather
Eyes: Hay-fever; profuse, watery discharge, worse in open air
Every time he takes cold it settles in eyes
Face: Humid eruption on cheeks and face generally
Tearing in cheek extending to ear, orbit, and jaw, preceded by coldness of parts, and attended by canine hunger
Nose: Stuffs up when there is a cold rain
Wants nose kept warm, least cold air stops the nose
Ears: Earache, buzzing, stitches, and swelling of middle-ear catarrh
Urine: Ischuria from wading with bare feet in cold water
Urine has thick, mucous, purulent sediment
Catarrh of bladder from taking cold
Back: Pain in small of back, as after long stooping
Stiffness and lameness across neck and shoulders, after getting cold and wet
Female: Suppression of menses from cold or dampness
Dysmenorrhoea, with blotches all over; mammae engorged and sore, delicate, sensitive to cold
Before appearance of menses, a rash appears on skin, or sexual excitement
Skin: Red spots, urticaria, brought on by exposure, or sour stomach
Swelling and indurated glands from cold
Pruritus, always worse in cold, wet weather
Thick, brown-yellow crusts, bleeding when scratched
Humid eruptions on face, genitals, hands etc. warts, large, smooth, on face and palmar surface of hands
Extremities: Paralysis: paralyzed limbs, feet icy cold
Rheumatic symptoms after acute skin eruptions

details: Hot days and cold nights toward the close of summer are especially favorable to the action of Dulcamara, and is one of the remedies that correspond in their symptoms to the conditions found as effects of damp weather, colds after exposure to wet, especially diarrhoea. It has a specific relation also to the SKIN, GLANDS, and digestive organs, MUCOUS MEMBRANES secreting more profusely while the skin is inactive. The RHEUMATIC TROUBLES induced by damp cold are aggravated by every cold change and somewhat relieved by moving about. Results from sitting on cold, damp ground. Icy coldness. One-sided spasms with speechlessness. Paralysis of single parts. Congestive headache, with neuralgia and dry nose. Patients living or working in damp, cold basements. (NAT-SULPH.) Eruptions on hands, arms or face around the menstrual period.
